trans-unit.source: Add authentication to your Windows Runtime 8.1 universal app | Azure Mobile Apps
trans-unit.target: Add authentication to your Windows Runtime 8.1 universal app | Azure Mobile Apps

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure App Service Mobile Apps to authenticate users of your Windows app using a variety of identity providers, including: AAD, Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure App Service Mobile Apps to authenticate users of your Windows app using a variety of identity providers, including: AAD, Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: Add authentication to your Windows app
trans-unit.target: Add authentication to your Windows app

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to add cloud-based authentication to your mobile app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to add cloud-based authentication to your mobile app.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the Mobile Apps quickstart project using an identity provider that is supported by Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the Mobile Apps quickstart project using an identity provider that is supported by Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: After being successfully authenticated and authorized by your Mobile App backend, the user ID value is displayed.
trans-unit.target: After being successfully authenticated and authorized by your Mobile App backend, the user ID value is displayed.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Apps quickstart.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Apps quickstart.

trans-unit.source: You must first complete the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Apps](app-service-mobile-windows-store-dotnet-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: You must first complete the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Apps](app-service-mobile-windows-store-dotnet-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: Register your app for authentication and configure the App Service
trans-unit.target: Register your app for authentication and configure the App Service

trans-unit.source: Restrict permissions to authenticated users
trans-unit.target: Restrict permissions to authenticated users

trans-unit.source: With one of the Windows app projects set as the start-up project, press the F5 key to run the app; verify that an unhandled exception with a status code of 401 (Unauthorized) is raised after the app starts.
trans-unit.target: With one of the Windows app projects set as the start-up project, press the F5 key to run the app; verify that an unhandled exception with a status code of 401 (Unauthorized) is raised after the app starts.

trans-unit.source: This happens because the app attempts to access your Mobile App Code as an unauthenticated user, but the *TodoItem* table now requires authentication.
trans-unit.target: This happens because the app attempts to access your Mobile App Code as an unauthenticated user, but the *TodoItem* table now requires authentication.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will update the app to authenticate users before requesting resources from your App Service.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will update the app to authenticate users before requesting resources from your App Service.

trans-unit.source: Add authentication to the app
trans-unit.target: Add authentication to the app

trans-unit.source: Store the authentication token on the client
trans-unit.target: Store the authentication token on the client

trans-unit.source: The previous example showed a standard sign-in, which requires the client to contact both the identity provider and the App Service every time that the app starts.
trans-unit.target: The previous example showed a standard sign-in, which requires the client to contact both the identity provider and the App Service every time that the app starts.

trans-unit.source: Not only is this method inefficient, you can run into usage-relates issues should many customers try to start you app at the same time.
trans-unit.target: Not only is this method inefficient, you can run into usage-relates issues should many customers try to start you app at the same time.

trans-unit.source: A better approach is to cache the authorization token returned by your App Service and try to use this first before using a provider-based sign-in.
trans-unit.target: A better approach is to cache the authorization token returned by your App Service and try to use this first before using a provider-based sign-in.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]You can cache the token issued by App Services regardless of whether you are using client-managed or service-managed authentication.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]You can cache the token issued by App Services regardless of whether you are using client-managed or service-managed authentication.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial uses service-managed authentication.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial uses service-managed authentication.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Now that you completed this basic authentication tutorial, consider continuing on to one of the following tutorials:
trans-unit.target: Now that you completed this basic authentication tutorial, consider continuing on to one of the following tutorials:

trans-unit.source: Add push notifications to your Windows app
trans-unit.target: Add push notifications to your Windows app

trans-unit.source: Learn how to add push notifications support to your app and configure your Mobile App backend to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to add push notifications support to your app and configure your Mobile App backend to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications.

trans-unit.source: Enable offline sync for your Windows app
trans-unit.target: Enable offline sync for your Windows app

trans-unit.source: Learn how to add offline support your app using an Mobile App backend.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to add offline support your app using an Mobile App backend.

trans-unit.source: Offline sync allows end-users to interact with a mobile app—viewing, adding, or modifying data—even when there is no network connection.
trans-unit.target: Offline sync allows end-users to interact with a mobile app—viewing, adding, or modifying data—even when there is no network connection.
